result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Mario Anthony Jacobs was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mario Anthony Jacobs is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Mario Anthony Jacobs was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Mario Anthony Jacobs was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharge and the supervisoin fees. Bail if any to apply.  25% of prison wages to apply.  If still not paid, remainder to be paid during period of Extended Supervision.  If there is any more due and owing, a civil judgment is to issue.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.074 of Wisconsin Statutes.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements as to sentencing by state and defense.  Additional statement/s by:  Shaunda P.
As to count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 76 months in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 133 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 38 months and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 38 months with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges and the supervision fees, bail, if any to apply, 25% of prison wages to apply, if still not paid, remainder to be paid                  during his period of extended supervision.  If there is any more due and owing, a civil judgment is to issue.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
         Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment signed by the defendant and filed.  
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin 
        statutes.
     *  Defendant to have no contact with the victim until the agent believes it is appropriate.  There may be 3rd party contact for time with the children.
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.

 As to count 3:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction, concurrent with count 1.
*  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges and the supervision fees, bail, if any to apply, 25% of prison wages to apply from count 1, if still not paid, remainder to be paid during his period of extended supervision.  If there is any more due and owing, a civil judgment is to issue.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 667
cf

Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The jurors informed the court that they were deadlocked.
Jury back in box.  Court gave the jurors the Allen instruction and asked them to continue to deliberate.
At the hour of 4:20 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, Joshua P., brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to count 1 as charged, and GUILTY as to count 3 without the penalty enhancer, "Use of a Dangerous Weapon"; and NOT GUILTY as to count 2,  which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts as to count 1 and count 3 (without the penalty enhancer) and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdicts.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to counts 1 and 3.  Court ordered a judgment of ACQUITTAL as to count 2.
Defendant remanded for sentencing.
.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
The parties are back in court to continue with the jury trial.  The jurors started their deliberations at 09:00 a.m... Questions received.
.
The court released the jurors for the lunch hour..
.

Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are back in court to continue with the jury.
Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Angelene B., Adonis Ford of the Housing Authority,  Milwaukee Police Officer, Lawrence Pope Jr., and Shaunda P. and Milwaukee Police Officer, Aja Chirpke.   Exhibits 1 through 7 received by the court.  Exhibit 8 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box. Defense rests.   State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Sheriff's Deputies Pamela Terrell and Randy Jackacs were duly sworn at 4:56 p.m..  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  
The court released the jurors for the evening.  Jury instructed to return at 09:00 a.m.to start their deliberations. 
Jury out of box.  Exhibit 9 received.
.
Court concluded for the evening.
.

Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
There was additional discovery given to the defense.  Court is willing to adjourn the case for 1 week but defense wants to proceed.
 Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:10 a.m.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.   Court instructed jury.  
.
Court will adjourn for the lunch hour.
.
Case passed.
.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
 Final pretrial conference held.  Defendant rejects State's offer.  Case remains calendared on 10/07/2015 at 08:30 a.m.for jury trial in Branch 36.

Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Mario Anthony Jacobs in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Lawrence Pope. Exhibit 1 received. State rests. Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  With agreeance of all parties, Court took judicial notice of case 08CF1738. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court granted defense request. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to trial.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
